text: Bonnie Jean Baxter (born July 30, 1946) is an American artist. Born in Texarkana, Texas, she has lived in Canada since 1972. Baxter is known for her artworks that combine animal and human forms. In 2017 she was awarded the prix Charles-Biddle. In 2019 she was the subject of a retrospective exhibition at the Musée d’art contemporain des Laurentides. Baxter's work is included in the collection of the Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:20th-century Canadian women artists Category:21st-century Canadian women artists Category:Living people
title: Bonnie Baxter
